t: Praise*p ye the Lord.*s Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord,*s that delighteth greatly in his commandments.
His*p seed shall be mighty upon earth: the generation of the upright shall be blessed.
Wealth*p and riches shall be in his house: and his righteousness endureth for ever.
Unto*p the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
A*p good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion.
Surely*p he shall not be moved for ever: the righteous shall be in everlasting remembrance.
He*p shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.*s
His*p heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.
He*p hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; his righteousness endureth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honour.
The*p wicked shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away: the desire of the wicked shall perish.
